messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] breeding animals
messages.msgSnippet: Rabbits are used because they are cheap and they breed like rabbit and true to type.  If you are breeding New Zealand Whites or even Californians, all of the
messages.messageBody:
Rabbits are used because they are cheap and they breed like "rabbit" and
true to type. If you are breeding New Zealand Whites or even Californians,
all of the adults from a litter will usually max out at within an ounce of
the same weight. They mature quickly and they are easily handled. Rats are
used for the same reason and also because they grow tumors like crazy and
can be used for tumor/cancer testing.

Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: Julie Stauffer <jnjstau@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, December 16, 2001 3:33 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] breeding animals


> <<the reason they use rabbits is they don't make that much noise when
being
> tortured during experiments>>
>
> Actually, being witness to a botched rabbit butchering, I can say rabbits
> make a great deal of noise, horrifying similar to a baby's cry.
>
> Julie

messages.subject: breeding animals
messages.messageBody:
<<the reason they use rabbits is they don't make that much noise when being
tortured during experiments>>

Actually, being witness to a botched rabbit butchering, I can say rabbits
make a great deal of noise, horrifying similar to a baby's cry.

Julie
